question: In which nation the Garamba National Park is located?
explanation: Garamba National Park is located in the Democratic Republic of Congo. It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of Africa's oldest parks. It has been managed by the "African Parks" since 2005. It is part of the Sudano-Guinean Savanna Zone. It had once the last wild population of the northern white rhinoceros. This park is included in the UNESCO List of World Heritage in Danger.
